channel.title: 2D Game Developement Team
channel.description:
[CENTER][IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/v3px4x.png[/img] [COLOR=#b22222][B][U]Welcome[/U][/B][/COLOR] Hello people! I've recently decided to begin a small development team to program 2D games and sell them to different companies. I have already began on a 2D side scrolling game. I've created the first level with some enemies and obviously the main character. I've added health and fireballs. I have also added a currency the fireballs. I have also recently created a point system. This point system is earned by killing the enemies and at the end of each level, you are able to purchase new abilities and power ups. I've been having great luck with this game.
[COLOR=#008000][B][U]What do I do?[/U][/B][/COLOR] Well, to begin, my name is Kyle and I love to program. I usually program using java. I love java. I've created several RSPS's in my lifetime and I have also had a lot of practice with java. I've gotten help, I've been taught and I've taken classes as I still am. I mainly program because I find it fun and once I'm done, I can't shake off the greatest feeling of accomplishment. I also do Graphics, VB.net, and Video Editing.
[B][U][COLOR=#008000]What's this thread about?[/COLOR] [/U][/B]I am creating this thread because I wouldn't mind a little help on programming my games so progression go's faster and money is made quicker. I am looking for a few people who are interested in joining my development team. Sadly, it is only I and Andreas in the team. I do the programming and he prefers to do some designing. I would love to introduce many more people to the team. I am an outgoing guy and I do not have an uncontrolable temper. I listen attentively and I take most ideas into consideration. I am not to strict about deadlines although I do prefer things being atleast started when I ask. [COLOR=#008000] [/COLOR][B][U][COLOR=#008000]Who am I looking for?[/COLOR][/U][/B] - 2 Java Programmers - 2 Designer - 2 HTML/CSS designer/programmer - 2 "Ideas Guy" - 3 Staff members for forums and website - 1 Forums Creator and Hoster - 1 Team Leader - 1 Group Leader That is what I do need so far.
[B][U][COLOR=#008000]How to apply for the team?[/COLOR] [/U][/B]It is preferred to apply over Skype although I do accept applications over e-mail. If you apply over e-mail, please let me know in the comments below this thread. When you apply, please fill out this form in skype or e-mail:
1. How old are you? 2. What is your current job? 3. Are you still in school? 4. When is your birthday? 5. What is your e-mail? 6. What is your hours of availability for the team? 7. What are you applying for? (Choose from the list above) 8. Are you active on the computer? 9. What would you consider your skill on what you chose on question 7? 10. What is your full name? 11. What country are you from? 12. What's your timezone?
It's a simple application. Currently I am in need of all what I've listed above.
[B][U][COLOR=#008000]My [/COLOR][COLOR=#ffa500]availability[/COLOR] [COLOR=#008000]to program?[/COLOR] [/U][/B]I am almost always available. I do have life to! All I'm getting at is I put a lot of time and effort into my work. I am in grade 13 and going to university and getting into the trades. I am looking forward to becoming a mechanic. I will also attempt to become a programmer for PS3 and other gaming consoles.
I want to thank you for taking the time to read this thread.
[COLOR=#0000ff][B][U]Contact Information[/U][/B][/COLOR][B] Skype: [COLOR=#00ff00]dragonxkyle[/COLOR] E-Mail: [EMAIL="skyrimian376@gmail.com"]skyrimian376@gmail.com[/EMAIL] [/B]:awesome: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ I am looking forward to [COLOR=#00ff00]meeting [/COLOR]you! [COLOR=#00ff00]Thanks[/COLOR], [COLOR=#0000ff]Kyle [/COLOR][COLOR=#ff0000]Graham[/COLOR] Also, we sell to arcade website companies. I was also thinking of programming a game and building on to it. Anyways, see you soon :)[/CENTER]

item.title: 2D Game Developement Team
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

and there are plenty of cons with having to connect to the internet to even access a game as well
Well then it's a good thing you don't have to after the first time you play it (unless you're expecting him to distribute CD-ROMs).

http://diveintohtml5.info/offline.html

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:18, topic:529281”][quote]
http://youtube.com/html5
[/quote]
does not have older browser support[/quote]

SitePoint – 1 May 13

Browser Trends May 2013: IE8 Drops Below 10% — SitePoint

Craig takes his regular look at the desktop and mobile browser usage charts. While IE8 dropped below 10%, only Internet Explorer escaped unscathed from Chrome's regular rise.

Browser Trends May 2013: IE8 Drops Below 10%

It’s better to expect everyone to have a modern browser than to expect they have random browser plugins. Java is completely useless on the web nowadays so there’s no reason to expect anybody to have it. They’d most likely update their browser before downloading suspicious EXEs (referring to downloadable games).

[quote=“Davidi2, post:17, topic:529281”][quote author=tigerclan link=topic=648037.msg4359106#msg4359106 date=1378329522]
most companies are switching to html5. staying with old technologies is just going to hurt them in the long run. im not talking shit about java, im just saying you might as well be using new technology that is going to be a standard soon
[/quote]if he’s making a browser based game sure html5 is a lot better than an applet, but who said he was? what I got out of this was he wanted to make a 2d java game and you guys are saying he should make a browser game instead[/quote]The web can just be used as another platform for games.

Read full topic

item.title: 2D Game Developement Team
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:15, topic:529281”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=648037.msg4359102#msg4359102 date=1378328600]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=648037.msg4359094#msg4359094 date=1378328063]

[quote author=tigerclan link=topic=648037.msg4359092#msg4359092 date=1378327807]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=648037.msg4359086#msg4359086 date=1378327242]

Actually my comment was far from stupid. Javascript requires no third party plugins to run and can be ran on pcs, tablets, phones, etc. It’s the ideal language to program a game in nowadays
[/quote]it requires a browser to be installed, donnit? that still counts. also not requiring a ‘third party plugin’ doesnt mean it’s an ideal language by any means

(pls note I am not saying java is the best for making games, simply pointing out that your logic is dumb)

if youre doing web applets then you need your browser and java installed. thats all im saying. you dont have to be a smartass to try and make yourself look cool
[/quote]and if you want to watch youtube you need to have flash and your browser installed? do you really not see how your logic literally means nothing?
[/quote]It doesn’t “mean nothing”. Flash doesn’t work on a lot of platforms, and is proprietary software developed by a single company. Web browsers are on almost any platform that connects to the internet, so there’s no hassle with any sorts of plugins.
[/quote]and there are plenty of cons with having to connect to the internet to even access a game as well

[quote author=tigerclan link=topic=648037.msg4359099#msg4359099 date=1378328397]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=648037.msg4359094#msg4359094 date=1378328063]

[quote author=tigerclan link=topic=648037.msg4359092#msg4359092 date=1378327807]

Actually my comment was far from stupid. Javascript requires no third party plugins to run and can be ran on pcs, tablets, phones, etc. It’s the ideal language to program a game in nowadays
[/quote]it requires a browser to be installed, donnit? that still counts. also not requiring a ‘third party plugin’ doesnt mean it’s an ideal language by any means

(pls note I am not saying java is the best for making games, simply pointing out that your logic is dumb)

if youre doing web applets then you need your browser and java installed. thats all im saying. you dont have to be a smartass to try and make yourself look cool
[/quote]and if you want to watch youtube you need to have flash and your browser installed? do you really not see how your logic literally means nothing?

http://youtube.com/html5
[/quote]Ok, how about any other web game or tool that uses flash then, lol. Didnt only mean youtube[/quote]

most companies are switching to html5. staying with old technologies is just going to hurt them in the long run. im not talking shit about java, im just saying you might as well be using new technology that is going to be a standard soon

Read full topic

[/quote]it requires a browser to be installed, donnit? that still counts. also not requiring a ‘third party plugin’ doesnt mean it’s an ideal language by any means

(pls note I am not saying java is the best for making games, simply pointing out that your logic is dumb)

if youre doing web applets then you need your browser and java installed. thats all im saying. you dont have to be a smartass to try and make yourself look cool
[/quote]and if you want to watch youtube you need to have flash and your browser installed? do you really not see how your logic literally means nothing?
[/quote]It doesn’t “mean nothing”. Flash doesn’t work on a lot of platforms, and is proprietary software developed by a single company. Web browsers are on almost any platform that connects to the internet, so there’s no hassle with any sorts of plugins.[/quote]and there are plenty of cons with having to connect to the internet to even access a game as well

[quote=“tigerclan, post:13, topic:529281”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=648037.msg4359094#msg4359094 date=1378328063]

[quote author=tigerclan link=topic=648037.msg4359092#msg4359092 date=1378327807]

Actually my comment was far from stupid. Javascript requires no third party plugins to run and can be ran on pcs, tablets, phones, etc. It’s the ideal language to program a game in nowadays
[/quote]it requires a browser to be installed, donnit? that still counts. also not requiring a ‘third party plugin’ doesnt mean it’s an ideal language by any means

(pls note I am not saying java is the best for making games, simply pointing out that your logic is dumb)

if youre doing web applets then you need your browser and java installed. thats all im saying. you dont have to be a smartass to try and make yourself look cool
[/quote]and if you want to watch youtube you need to have flash and your browser installed? do you really not see how your logic literally means nothing?

http://youtube.com/html5[/quote]Ok, how about any other web game or tool that uses flash then, lol. Didnt only mean youtube (and also didn’t only mean flash, there are plenty of plugins this applies to)

The point you guys are missing is that everything has its requirements, and a java games requirements are not more of a hindrance than having to install flash or silverlight, which most people do in a heartbeat if it’s required

Read full topic
